subtitle: This deliciously fruity curry can be made as mild or as hot as preferred depending upon the strength of curry powder used.

method.text: Heat half the oil in a pan. Add the curry powder, paprika, onion and garlic and fry for 2-3 min or until softened, stirring constantly. Remove from pan and set aside.
Heat the remaining oil in the pan. Toss the beef in the flour to lightly coat, then fry for 5-8 min stirring constantly until well browned and sealed.

Gradually add the stock to the pan then bring to the boil and stir in the chutney, onion mixture, coriander seeds and sultanas. Transfer to an ovenproof casserole dish, cover and cook in the oven for 40 min.
Stir in the apricot, pineapple and coconut and cook for 20 min.
Adjust seasoning, transfer to a warmed serving dish. Garnish with the coriander.

title: Fruited beef curry
